text: hi my name is Mike Coleman I'm a
developer Advocate on the light sale
team here at Amazon web services and
today I'm going to take you through a
video that shows you some of the
capabilities of Amazon light sale but
before we get started I just wanted to
let you know that you don't have to try
to do everything at the same time that
I'm doing it on the screen we've got a
written guide in the description below
that you can go and download and then
after the video you can go try it all on
your own so let's get started
in this video we're going to take a look
at how you can create a Windows based
instance on Amazon light sale so I'm
starting here on the light cell home
page and I'm going to click create
instance and that's going to bring me to
the instance creation page and the first
thing I'm going to do is choose where I
want to run my instance
so I'll come up here I'll click this
link and you can see there's a bunch of
regions all across the globe you should
pick a region that's close to you or
your customers for me that would be
organ
after that I can come down here I can
click on the availability zones and I
can choose one of them now since I'm
only running a single instance this
isn't really important so we'll just
leave it at the default
next we're going to come down and we're
going to choose the Windows operating
system so I'm going to run Windows
server 2016.
next we'll scroll down and we can
optionally add a launch script here a
launch script is a Powershell script
that runs the very first time in
instance is booted up so you could use
Powershell to install software configure
system settings virtually anything you
could do with Powershell you could do
here in the script it will only run the
very first time instance is booted up
so now we'll come down and we'll choose
our instant size now instant sizes are
based on the amount of CPU the amount of
ram the the size of the disk and how
much network transfer you get so for me
I'm going to go ahead and do a fairly
large instance I'm going to select the
70 instance size here so I have enough
RAM and CPU
okay so now we're going to come down and
we're going to name the instance so I'm
just going to clear this out I'm going
to type in Windows instance and that's
great now the last thing we can do here
is we can add a tag to our instance a
tag is a way to sort and organize
resources so for instance if I wanted a
way to easily identify all of my
machines running the operating system
Windows I could type in OS here for the
the key and then I can give it a value
and in the future I could go in and
search by that value or sort by that
value and it's just a way for me to
organize all of those resources so with
that set I'll click create instance and
that'll get the windows instance off and
creating
it's going to take a couple of minutes
so let's just wait for that to finish
our instance is now up and running so
let me show you how to connect to it I'm
going to come up and I'm going to click
on this connection icon here and what
that's going to do is it's going to
start an RDP session in the browser so
RDP is the remote desktop protocol it's
the protocol used to connect remotely to
Windows servers so here you now have
full control over the windows instance
install software make system updates
anything you would do at a local
keyboard you can now do remotely and
that's it that's how easy it is to
create a Windows instance with Amazon
light sale
